name: Old Geezers Quiz | Classic Movies | 10 Questions

questions.text: Which Bogart movie included Walter Brennan in the cast?
questions.explanation:
To Have and Have Not.

	Brennan played Bogie's not-too-swift sidekick. Brennan, a repeat Oscar winner, had a fine career with many great supporting performances along the way. Later, it was tv: "Real McCoys" and "Guns of Will Sonnett".

questions.text: Walter Brennan is in all of the following classic westerns EXCEPT which one?
questions.explanation:
The Ox-Bow Incident.

	He's John Wayne's buddy in "Red River" and he's one of Wayne's deputies in "Rio Bravo". He's Ike Clanton in "Clementine" (starring Henry Fonda).

questions.text: Walter Brennan also appeared in "Bad Day at Black Rock". Which of the following was NOT in the cast with him?
questions.explanation:
Earl Holliman.

	Jagger was the weary sheriff. Marvin and Borgnine were Robert Ryan's henchmen. Brennan was the local doctor.

questions.text: Wilford Brimley starred in "Absence of Malice" with Paul Newman. What was his role?
questions.explanation:
U.S. Attorney investigating allegations

	Brimley has a brief, but solid performance as the "tough old bird" judicial type at the end of the movie. He always gives an appealing "crusty" turn. Now, he's doing diabetes ads: ("check your blood and check it often - there's no reason not to.")

questions.text: Wilford Brimley starred in which of these classic baseball movies?
questions.explanation:
The Natural.

	He played Robert Redford's baseball coach. (Brennan was in "Yankees".)

questions.text: Wilford Brimley starred in "Cocoon" with all of the following oldsters EXCEPT who?
questions.explanation:
Art Carney.

	Good Ron Howard movie. Oscar for old veteran Ameche. Cronyn also had a long, fine career.

questions.text: Which of these seagoing classics included Edgar Buchanan in the cast?
questions.explanation:
Sea Hawk.

	Buchanan is one of the prisoners-turned-pirates. He's relatively young in this one ... but he's never too young in his movies: acting wasn't his first career. (That was dentistry.) TV included "Judge Roy Bean" and "Petticoat Junction". Teddy Bear quality.

questions.text: Edgar Buchanan starred in which of these classic westerns?
questions.explanation:
Shane.

	He's one of the homesteaders. (There's also a young Ellen Corby in the movie.)

questions.text: Arthur O'Connell starred as an assistant to James Stewart in what classic lawyer movie?
questions.explanation:
Anatomy of a Murder.

	O'Connell also played "old coot" types. "Mockingbird" was Gregory Peck" and "Wind" was Spencer Tracy. "Compulsion" was Orson Welles.

questions.text: George Burns starred in "The Sunshine Boys". Who was his co-star?
questions.explanation:
Walter Matthau.

	Is there anybody who didn't like the old guy?
